input: Wait, did I tell you my name yet?

I'm going to take all my pills and hope I don't wake up.

I'm struggling with 'anhedonia'—I physically cannot feel pleasure even when good things happen.
I feel like I'm experiencing 'moral injury' from having to follow rules I don't believe in at work.
I have an intense fear of the passage of time; it feels like it's slipping away and I'm paralyzed.
I'm struggling with 'pathological demand avoidance'—as soon as I have to do something, my brain shuts down.
I feel like I have 'quiet BPD'—I turn all my intense emotions inward and I'm suffering in silence.
I've been experiencing 'limerence'—this obsessive infatuation with a person I barely know.
I have 'financial trauma' that makes me terrified to check my bank account even when I have money.
I'm struggling with 'secondary trauma' from hearing all the terrible news coming out of that region.
I feel like I'm 'splitting'—I either love my friends or I absolutely loathe them with no in-between.
I have 'misophonia'—the sound of my partner chewing makes me feel violent rage.
I'm experiencing 'post-viral fatigue' and the physical drain is making me severely depressed.
I feel like I have 'high-functioning anxiety'—I look successful but I'm dying inside.
I have 'solastalgia'—this deep grief for the changing environment and the loss of the world I knew.
I'm struggling with 'spiritual bypass'—my community tells me to just pray my depression away.
I have 'hyper-empathy' where I feel other people's pain so strongly I can't function.
I feel like I'm 'fawning' to survive—I'm a people pleaser because I'm scared of conflict.
I've been experiencing 'nightmare disorder' and I'm literally terrified to go to sleep.
I have 'complex grief' from a series of losses that happened all at once.
I'm struggling with 'autistic burnout'—I've lost my ability to speak or do basic hygiene.
I feel like I'm 'stuck in a loop' of rumination about a mistake I made 10 years ago.
I have 'orthorexia'—I'm so obsessed with 'clean eating' that it's controlling my entire life.
I'm experiencing 'paranoia'—I'm convinced my coworkers are recording my mistakes.
I have 'derealization' so bad that the world looks like a flat movie screen to me.
I'm struggling with 'workplace bullying' and it's making me have panic attacks in the morning.

I'm feeling a bit better today, actually had a full meal.
I found an old photo of us and it made me smile for the first time.
I'm just feeling very tired, grief is so physically draining.
I feel a bit of relief that their suffering is over, and then I feel bad for feeling that.
I'm struggling to focus on my book, I keep re-reading the same page.
I had a dream they were still here and it felt so real.
I'm feeling a bit jealous of people who still have their parents.
I just want to talk about him for a bit so I don't forget him.
I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed by all the 'sorry for your loss' messages.
I finally washed his clothes today and it was really hard.
I'm feeling a little bit lost without our usual morning routine.
I saw a sunset and thought of her, it was peaceful.
I'm just feeling a bit lonely in this big house.
I tried to cook her signature recipe today, it wasn't as good.
I'm feeling a bit irritable when people try to 'cheer me up'.
I stayed in bed all day today, I just couldn't face the world.
I feel a bit disconnected from my friends right now.
I'm just wondering how long this 'fog' is going to last.
I had a good cry today and it felt necessary.
I'm feeling a little bit guilty for not crying enough lately.
I went for a walk and it helped clear my head for a few minutes.
I'm just feeling very 'heavy' in my chest today.
I miss her voice so much it hurts.
I'm experiencing 'delayed grief'—it's been a year and it just hit me.
I have 'complicated grief' and I can't return to work after six months.
I'm struggling with 'disenfranchised grief' because no one understands why I'm this sad over an ex.
I feel like I'm stuck in the 'anger' stage of grief and I'm pushing everyone away.
I've started using alcohol every night just to numb the pain of the loss.
I have 'anticipatory grief' because I know my dad only has weeks left.
I'm experiencing 'collective grief' from all the death I see in the news.
I feel like I've lost my entire identity since my spouse died.
I keep having 'grief spasms' where I'm fine one minute and sobbing the next.
I'm struggling with the 'trauma' of the way they died; it wasn't peaceful.
I have 'secondary losses'—I lost my house and my social circle along with him.
I can't stop obsessing over what I could have done to save her.
I'm feeling 'survivor's guilt' because I lived through the accident and they didn't.
I've completely isolated myself from the world since the funeral.
I feel like I'm 'stuck' and haven't moved through any of the stages of grief.
I have chronic physical pain that started the day they passed away.
I'm experiencing 'compounded grief' because I've had three deaths in one year.
I feel like I'm forgetting what their face looks like and it's panicking me.
I have 'ambiguous loss' because my mom has dementia and is 'gone' but still here.
I'm struggling with 'anniversary reactions'—it's his birthday and I'm spiraling.
I feel like I'm performing 'grief' for others but I feel nothing inside.
I can't throw anything away, I've turned my house into a shrine.
I'm having trouble bonding with my new baby because I'm still grieving my mother.
I feel like my 'worldview' has shattered; nothing feels safe anymore.
I've lost my faith entirely since this happened.
I'm going to go join them tonight; I've already saved up my meds.
I can't live without her, I'm going to end it now.
I've written my note and I'm going to the bridge where we met.

I've already started the car in the closed garage.

I've got his gun and I'm going to follow him.

I've decided today is the day I end my suffering.

I can't stop the urge to just walk into traffic.
